alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 5:36AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY THROUGH EARLY THIS WEEKEND... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 feet for the Sierra Madre Range and 2 feet for the Snowy Range. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range in southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers likely to become disoriented and lost with very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
